byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan; Khalid Alokozay from Bati Kot District, Afghanistan; and Mujib Mashal, Jawad Sukhanyar and Ahmad Shakib from Kabul.

abstract: Statistics provided by American military show that casualty rate in 2015 among Afghan security forces in fight against Taliban is up more than 50 percent compared to similar period in 2014, with 4,100 Afghan soldiers and police officers killed; interviews with Afghan military officials reveal that fight has become precarious stalemate, which has put pressure on Pres Ashraf Ghani's government and could affect whether Pres Obama follows through on complete withdrawal of troops.
lead_paragraph: With months of heavy fighting still ahead, 2015 is already shaping up to be worse than last year for the Afghan Army and the national police.

headline.main: Afghan Security Forces Struggle Just to Maintain Stalemate
headline.print_headline: Casualties Up, Afghan Forces Try to Hang On

snippet: With months of heavy fighting still ahead, 2015 is already shaping up to be worse than last year for the Afghan Army and the national police.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
